Checks.name: dangling-service
Checks.description: Indicates when services do not have any associated deployments.
Checks.remediation: Confirm that your service's selector correctly matches the labels on one of your deployments.

Checks.name: deprecated-service-account-field
Checks.description: Indicates when deployments use the deprecated serviceAccount field.
Checks.remediation: Use the serviceAccountName field instead. If you must specify serviceAccount, ensure values for serviceAccount and serviceAccountName match.

Checks.name: docker-sock
Checks.description: Alert on deployments with docker.sock mounted in containers.
Checks.remediation: Ensure the Docker socket is not mounted inside any containers by removing the associated  Volume and VolumeMount in deployment yaml specification. If the Docker socket is mounted inside a container it could allow processes running within  the container to execute Docker commands which would effectively allow for full control of the host.

Checks.name: drop-net-raw-capability
Checks.description: Indicates when containers do not drop NET_RAW capability
Checks.remediation: NET_RAW makes it so that an application within the container is able to craft raw packets, use raw sockets, and bind to any address. Remove this capability in the containers under containers security contexts.

Checks.name: duplicate-env-var
Checks.description: Check that duplicate named env vars aren't passed to a deployment like.
Checks.remediation: Confirm that your DeploymentLike doesn't have duplicate env vars names.

Checks.name: env-var-secret
Checks.description: Indicates when objects use a secret in an environment variable.
Checks.remediation: Do not use raw secrets in environment variables. Instead, either mount the secret as a file or use a secretKeyRef. Refer to https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/secret/#using-secrets for details.

Checks.name: host-ipc
Checks.description: Alert on pods/deployment-likes with sharing host's IPC namespace
Checks.remediation: Ensure the host's IPC namespace is not shared.

Checks.name: host-network
Checks.description: Alert on pods/deployment-likes with sharing host's network namespace
Checks.remediation: Ensure the host's network namespace is not shared.

Checks.name: host-pid
Checks.description: Alert on pods/deployment-likes with sharing host's process namespace
Checks.remediation: Ensure the host's process namespace is not shared.

Checks.name: invalid-target-ports
Checks.description: Indicates when deployments or services are using port names that are violating specifications.
Checks.remediation: Ensure that port naming is in conjunction with the specification. For more information, please look at the Kubernetes Service specification on this page: https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/_print/#ServiceSpec. And additional information about IANA Service naming can be found on the following page: https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6335.html#section-5.1.

Checks.name: latest-tag
Checks.description: Indicates when a deployment-like object is running a container with an invalid container image
Checks.remediation: Use a container image with a specific tag other than latest.

Checks.name: liveness-port
Checks.description: Indicates when containers have a liveness probe to a not exposed port.
Checks.remediation: Check which ports you've exposed and ensure they match what you have specified in the liveness probe.

Checks.name: mismatching-selector
Checks.description: Indicates when deployment selectors fail to match the pod template labels.
Checks.remediation: Confirm that your deployment selector correctly matches the labels in its pod template.

Checks.name: no-anti-affinity
Checks.description: Indicates when deployments with multiple replicas fail to specify inter-pod anti-affinity, to ensure that the orchestrator attempts to schedule replicas on different nodes.
Checks.remediation: Specify anti-affinity in your pod specification to ensure that the orchestrator attempts to schedule replicas on different nodes. Using podAntiAffinity, specify a labelSelector that matches pods for the deployment, and set the topologyKey to kubernetes.io/hostname. Refer to https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/assign-pod-node/#inter-pod-affinity-and-anti-affinity for details.

Checks.name: no-extensions-v1beta
Checks.description: Indicates when objects use deprecated API versions under extensions/v1beta.
Checks.remediation: Migrate using the apps/v1 API versions for the objects. Refer to https://kubernetes.io/blog/2019/07/18/api-deprecations-in-1-16/ for details.

Checks.name: no-read-only-root-fs
Checks.description: Indicates when containers are running without a read-only root filesystem.
Checks.remediation: Set readOnlyRootFilesystem to true in the container securityContext.

Checks.name: non-existent-service-account
Checks.description: Indicates when pods reference a service account that is not found.
Checks.remediation: Create the missing service account, or refer to an existing service account.

Checks.name: pdb-max-unavailable
Checks.description: Indicates when a PodDisruptionBudget has a maxUnavailable value that will always prevent disruptions of pods created by related deployment-like objects.
Checks.remediation: Change the PodDisruptionBudget to have maxUnavailable set to a value greater than 0. Refer to https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/run-application/configure-pdb/ for more information.

Checks.name: pdb-min-available
Checks.description: Indicates when a PodDisruptionBudget sets a minAvailable value that will always prevent disruptions of pods created by related deployment-like objects.
Checks.remediation: Change the PodDisruptionBudget to have minAvailable set to a number lower than the number of replicas in the related deployment-like objects. Refer to https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/run-application/configure-pdb/ for more information.

Checks.name: pdb-unhealthy-pod-eviction-policy
Checks.description: Indicates when a PodDisruptionBudget does not explicitly set the unhealthyPodEvictionPolicy field.
Checks.remediation: Set unhealthyPodEvictionPolicy to AlwaysAllow. Refer to https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/run-application/configure-pdb/#unhealthy-pod-eviction-policy for more information.

Checks.name: privilege-escalation-container
Checks.description: Alert on containers of allowing privilege escalation that could gain more privileges than its parent process.
Checks.remediation: Ensure containers do not allow privilege escalation by setting allowPrivilegeEscalation=false, privileged=false and removing CAP_SYS_ADMIN capability. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/security-context/ for more details.

Checks.name: privileged-container
Checks.description: Indicates when deployments have containers running in privileged mode.
Checks.remediation: Do not run your container as privileged unless it is required.

Checks.name: readiness-port
Checks.description: Indicates when containers have a readiness probe to a not exposed port.
Checks.remediation: Check which ports you've exposed and ensure they match what you have specified in the readiness probe.

Checks.name: run-as-non-root
Checks.description: Indicates when containers are not set to runAsNonRoot.
Checks.remediation: Set runAsUser to a non-zero number and runAsNonRoot to true in your pod or container securityContext. Refer to https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/security-context/ for details.

Checks.name: sensitive-host-mounts
Checks.description: Alert on deployments with sensitive host system directories mounted in containers
Checks.remediation: Ensure sensitive host system directories are not mounted in containers by removing those Volumes and VolumeMounts.

Checks.name: ssh-port
Checks.description: Indicates when deployments expose port 22, which is commonly reserved for SSH access.
Checks.remediation: Ensure that non-SSH services are not using port 22. Confirm that any actual SSH servers have been vetted.

Checks.name: startup-port
Checks.description: Indicates when containers have a startup probe to a not exposed port.
Checks.remediation: Check which ports you've exposed and ensure they match what you have specified in the startup probe.

Checks.name: unsafe-sysctls
Checks.description: Alert on deployments specifying unsafe sysctls that may lead to severe problems like wrong behavior of containers
Checks.remediation: Ensure container does not allow unsafe allocation of system resources by removing unsafe sysctls configurations. For more details see https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/administer-cluster/sysctl-cluster/ https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/commandline/run/#configure-namespaced-kernel-parameters-sysctls-at-runtime.

Checks.name: unset-cpu-requirements
Checks.description: Indicates when containers do not have CPU requests and limits set.
Checks.remediation: Set CPU requests for your container based on its requirements. Refer to https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/#requests-and-limits for details.

Checks.name: unset-memory-requirements
Checks.description: Indicates when containers do not have memory requests and limits set.
Checks.remediation: Set memory limits for your container based on its requirements. Refer to https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/#requests-and-limits for details.
